gurmukhi: sRI rGunwQ kmwn ly hwQ khO irskY ikh pY sr qwny ]149]
transliteration: Sriraghounaath Kamaan Le Haath Kahau Riskai Kih Pai Sar Taane||149||
translation: Getting hold of his bow in his hand, Ram said to Parashuram, “On whom you have stretched this arrow in anger?”149.
Speech of Parashuram addressed to Ram :

gurmukhi: jyqk bYn khy su khy ju pY Pyir khy qu pY jIq n jYho ]
transliteration: Jetak Bain Kahe Su Kahe Ju Pai Pher(i) Kahe Tu Pai Jeet Na Jaiho||
translation: “O Ram ! whatever you have said, you have said and now if you say anything further, then you will not remain alive;

gurmukhi: hwiQ hiQAwr ghy su ghy ju pY Pyir ghy qu pY Pyir n lYho ]
transliteration: Haath(i) Hathiaar Gade Su Gade Ju Pai Pher(i) Gade Tu Pai Pher(i) Na Laiho||
translation: “The weapon that you had to wield, you have wielded and if you try to wield anything more, your effort will be of no avail.”

gurmukhi: rwm irsY rx mY rGubIr kho BijkY kq pRwn bcYho ]
transliteration: Raam Risai Ran Mai Raghoubeer Kaho Bhaj(i) Kai Kat Praan Bachaiho||
translation: Then getting furious Parashuram said to Ram, “Say, where will you run away now from war and how will you save your life?

gurmukhi: qor srwsn sMkr ko hir sIA cly Gir jwn n pYho ]150]
transliteration: Tor Saraasan Sankar Ko Har(i) Seea Chale Ghar(i) Jaan Na Paiho||150||
translation: “O Ram ! breaking the bow of Shiva and now wedding Sita you will not be able to reach your home.”150.
Speech of Ram addressed to Parashuram:

gurmukhi: bol khy su shy ids jU ju pY Pyir khy qy pY pRwn KÍYho ]
transliteration: Bol Kahe Su Sahe Dij Joo Ju Pai Pher(i) Kahe Te Pai Praan Khvaiho||
translation: “O Brahmin ! you have already said whatever you wanted to say and if you say anything more now, you will have to risk your life.

gurmukhi: bolq AYNT khw sT ijau sB dwNq qurwie AbY Gir jYho ]
transliteration: Dolat Ainth Kahaa Sath Jio Sabh Daant Turaae Abai Ghar(i) Jaiho||
translation: “O fool ! why do you speak with such pride, you will have to go now to your home after getting your teeth broken and after receiving good tharashin.

gurmukhi: DIr qbY lihhY qum k`au jd BIr prI iek qIr clYho ]
transliteration: Dheer Tabai Lahehai Toum Kau Jad Bheer Pariik Teer Chaliho||
translation: “I am seeing you with patience; if I consider it necessary, then I shall have to discharge only one arrow.

gurmukhi: bwq sMBwr kho muiK qy ien bwqn ko Ab hI Pil pYho ]151]
transliteration: Baat Sanbhaar Kaho Moukh(i) Te In Baatan Ko Ab Hiphal(i) Paiho||151||
translation: “Therefore talk with restraint, otherwise you will receive the reward for such talk just now.”151.
